Package com.example.appointment.controller

Class ContactScheduleReportController

java.lang.Object
com.example.appointment.controller.Controller
com.example.appointment.controller.ReportsController
com.example.appointment.controller.ContactScheduleReportController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComboBoxListenerInterface, GetAppointmentsInterface, SQLControllerInterface
public class ContactScheduleReportController extends ReportsController implements GetAppointmentsInterface, ComboBoxListenerInterface
A controller that loads the Contact reports scene. This scene enables users to select and retrieve how many appointments that customer has.

  • Method Details

    • setContactIdComboBox

      public void setContactIdComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the contact ID ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • getContactIdList

      public List<Integer> getContactIdList() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that retrieves a list of contact ID values from the database. These values can be used to check which contacts have appointments.
      Returns:
      A list of contact IDs.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setTableView

      public void setTableView(int contactId) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException

      A method that sets up the TableView object by retrieving appointment objects from the database based on the select contact ID, placing them into a user object's appointment list, and then displaying that list in the table.
      They are four columns that have lambda expressions in this method
      1. appointmentStartTimeColumn
      2. appointmentEndTimeColumn
      3. startDateColumn
      4. endDateColumn

      The two time columns work by formatting the appointment date objects into the time format HH:mm for each cell in the column. The two date columns work the same way and format each appointment date object to the format of MM-dd-yyyy. These lambda expressions are an easy way to make the time and date information readable and still convertible with the actual appointment object in the database.
      Parameters:
      contactId - The ID of the contact that is passed in to the SQL query.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.
